p: The lowest number of seronegative participants was found in the group aged 50+ (1.0%). People from this age group were born before routine vaccination against rubella. In the pre-vaccination era, the average annual incidence of rubella was high. A large number of people could have come into a contact with the rubella virus as early as childhood and more frequently in older age, and therefore, were more likely to have acquired immunity from a natural infection.
